content:
Hello there, we recently had to udpate bots exclusion in our MDC instances and realized that :
https://github.com/CDLUC3/counter-processor depends on https://github.com/CDLUC3/Make-Data-Count (see https://github.com/CDLUC3/counter-processor/blob/master/config/config.yaml#L27).
Both repo have not been updated for many years.
https://github.com/CDLUC3/Make-Data-Count uses https://github.com/atmire/COUNTER-Robots and we decided to make a PR here https://github.com/atmire/COUNTER-Robots/pull/61.

My question is : what is the future of Make Data Count and Counter Processor in Dataverse ecosystem ?
Must we make an effort to keep https://github.com/CDLUC3/counter-processor up to date ?

A new way to support MDC has been created at https://github.com/datacite/datacite-tracker but we suspect it doesn't "just work" with Dataverse. Plus, because it runs in the browser, it doesn't count API downloads. See #community > DataCite Usage Tracker
Given that, yes, we still support Counter Processor. We'd like to set it up at Harvard someday: https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse.harvard.edu/issues/3
